html.question: What is HTML
html.answer:
Hypertext Markup Language
( HTML )
is the standard markup language for creating web pages.
It structures content using a system of elements and tags.

html.question: What is an Element
html.answer:
An element is a fundamental component in HTML, represented by a start tag, content, and an end tag.
Ex. <p> for paragraphs and <img> for images.

html.question: What is a Tag
html.answer:
Used to define elements in HTML,
tags consist of an opening <tag>, content, and a closing </tag>.

Ex. <h1> is the opening tag for a top-level heading.

html.question: What is an Attribute
html.answer:
Included in the opening tag,
Attribbutes provide additional information about HTML elements.

Ex. <a href="https://qarli.ca">

uses the href attribute.

html.question: What is a DOCTYPE Declaration
html.answer:
The DOCTYPE declaration specifies the HTML version being used by the document and helps browsers to render the page correctly.
Ex. <DOCTYPE html>

html.question: What is the Head
html.answer: The <head> section of an HTML document contains metadata, including the title, links to stylesheets, and other information that doesn't appear directly on the page.

html.question: What is the Body
html.answer: The <body> element contains the content of the HTML document, such as text, images, links, and other elements that are displayed on the webpage.

html.question: What are Heading Tags
html.answer: Heading tags ( <h1> to <h6> ) define headings of different levels, where <h1> is the highest level and <h6> is the lowest.

html.question: What is the Paragraph tag
html.answer: Separating blocks of text, the <p> tag is used to define paragraphs in HTML.

html.question: What is the Anchor tag
html.answer: The <a> tag creates hyperlinks, allowing users to navigate to other web pages or resources.

html.question: What is the Image Tag
html.answer: The <img> tag embeds images into a webpage, while the src attribute specifying the image source.

html.question: What are List Tags (ul, ol, li)
html.answer:
<ul> tag creates an unordered list,
<ol> tag creates an ordered list,
and <li> tag represents list items within these lists.

html.question: What is an Hyperlink ( href )
html.answer: The href attribute in the <a> tag specifies the destination URL for hyperlinks.

html.question: What is a URL
html.answer: Unified Resource Locator ( url ) is a human readable web address.

html.question: What are Forms
html.answer:
HTML forms ( <form> tag ) are used to collect user input.

Ex.
<form>
input filed, textbox, checkboxes, radio buttons, submit
</form>

html.question: What is an Input tag used for
html.answer: <input> elements are used within forms to create fields for various types of user input such as text, password, checkbox, etc.

html.question: This tag creates clickable _______, often used within forms.
html.answer: What is a <button> tag

html.question: This tag is a container used to group and structure content in HTML.
html.answer: What is a <div> tag

html.question: This tag is an inline container used for applying styles or scripting to a specific portion of text.
html.answer: What is the <span> tag.

html.question: To provide more meaning to the structure of a webpage, semantic elements such as <header>, <nav&gt, <section&gt, <article&gt, <aside>, and <footer&gt were introduce in which HTML version ?
html.answer: What is HTML5

html.question: _______ are used to include remarks within HTML code that are visible only to developers and editors.
html.answer:
What are comments.

Ex.
( <!-- multiline comments --> )
( // Single line comment )

css.question: What is CSS
css.answer:
Cascading Style Sheet ( CSS )
is used to define styles for your web pages.

This includes the design, layout and variations in display for different devices and screen sizes.

css.question: What is a Selector
css.answer:
Selectors are patterns that are used to select and style HTML elements.

They define the target elements for applying styles.

Ex. .class or #id

css.question: In CSS ________ define the visual style of selected elements
css.answer:
What are Properties.

They include attributes like color, font-size, margin, padding, etc.

css.question: _______ are assigned to CSS properties to determine the specific style characteristics.
css.answer:
What are values.

Ex.
color: red; width: 100%; height: 100vh;

Where 'red', '100%' and '100vh' are values.

css.question: The ______ model consists of content, padding, border, and margin. The _______ governs how space is distributed around and within an element.
css.answer:
What is the Box Model.

Ex.
block boxes
inline boxes

css.question: _______ in CSS refers to the arrangement and positioning of elements on a webpage.
css.answer:
What is the Layout.

Ex.

Techniques include Flexbox and Grid

css.question: Particularly useful for one dimensional layouts, ________ is a layout model that allows for the creation of flexible and efficient layouts.
CSS _______ is a two dimensional layout model. It allows for the creation of complex and responsive layouts with rows and columns.
This style element determines the placement of elements on a web page.
css.answer:
What is Positioning

Ex.
Common values include static, relative, absolute and fixed.

javascript.question: What is JavaScript
javascript.answer: JavaScript is an highlevel programming language.

javascript.question: What is a variable
javascript.answer:
Variables are containers for storing data values.

Ex. let x = 7

javascript.question: What are Data Types
javascript.answer:
JavaScript has several data types:
Number, String, Boolean, Object, and Array.

Ex. let name = 'Carla';
let age = 25;
let isStudent = true;
